@tymonbrown @NYSLabor @SenGianaris @SamQNS Tymon, do you live in NY's 7th Congressional District? If so can you fill out the "contact" form on my website and we can put you in touch with a caseworker on my staff. We can try to help. No promises but will do what we can.

Carefully monitoring the fire in Chinatown. My staff is in touch with the Mayor‚Äôs. Affected constituents can call my office. 718-599-3658.

Important information for NY veterans: The @VAVetBenefits will host a tele-townhall meeting TODAY at 4 p.m. on VA Benefits. Learn more about COVID-19 response, launch of Blue Water Navy Act and Solid Start program along with other new initiatives. More info below: https://t.co/IyMFY4Vxzs

A free, independent press is the hallmark of any democracy and actions by the Puerto Rican government to prevent journalists from covering its response to COVID-19 are shameful. During crises like a pandemic, it is more important the public be fully informed. My full statement: https://t.co/sVObsL8iVx

This is a stressful time for all New Yorkers. 

You should be aware of the NY State COVID-19 Emotional Support Helpline: 844-863-9314.

You are not alone. If you need help reach out.

I will be joining a press teleconference event at 4 pm with @RepJerryNadler @bradlander & others regarding COVID-19 risk for detainees and staff at federal detainment facilities. https://t.co/J9xZAbXNgh

As Chair of @HouseSmallBiz I have introduced the COVID-19 RELIEF for Small Businesses Act of 2020.  This bill will get badly needed help to small firms quickly. Continuing conversations with Leadership & other Chairs as stimulus package is assembled. 

Read more on my bill below: https://t.co/G8ooNS52JE

If the Trump Admin is ‚Äúinspired‚Äù by DACA recipients who are essential workers then it should stop using them as political pawns. DACA is at risk because Trump terminated it.

Trump can drop the DACA case at SCOTUS & extend protections while we recover from this crisis.

I've introduced legislation that would create a new direct lending program for small businesses harmed by #coronavirus. 

We need every tool at our disposal to help our economy recover from this crisis. https://t.co/1LPSUnOcfm

Today, the emergency supplemental package providing $8.3 bil to combat #COVID19 becomes law.  This includes the loans I proposed to help small businesses recover from the economic effects of this crisis.

https://t.co/taqKm15t3q

Last wk, I wrote a bill to help owners of small businesses recover from economic harm incurred by #COVID19. 

The $7B in loans I proposed has now passed the House AND the Senate as part of a larger package - soon to be law. 

Read more:    

https://t.co/VZjLsQjNU0

Proud that @HouseDemocrats are preparing supplemental legislation to fund earthquake relief in #PuertoRico. I look forward to seeing the bill released and I thank @SpeakerPelosi @AppropsDems @LeaderHoyer for working rapidly. We must help our fellow citizens recover & rebuild!

Bureau of Prison's website reports 28 people detained and 24 staff nat'lly tested positive for #COVID19. Having #MDCBrooklyn in my district I believe real numbers are worse & growing. We need #compassionaterelease for vulnerable detained who present no public safety threat.

100,000 Americans have tested positive for #COVID19.

1,000 have died.

The President is just now, finally, using #DefenseProductionAct to mass produce ventilators.

We need more - faster.
Testing supplies
Masks
Other PPE.

Use this Act to fully mobilize NOW @realDonaldTrump

On this #EqualPayDay I'm thinking of all the women disproportionately represented in front line jobs, ensuring the rest of us access essential goods and services like food, medicine and medical care.

Now more than ever we must reaffirm our commitment to the fight for equal pay.

Nearly 58 million people in America have been unable to pay for a prescription medicine at least once in the last 12 months. The Senate must #LowerDrugCosts by passing H.R. 3 into law! https://t.co/PDgH0J5ew8 https://t.co/RR20B6q8YL

When people are unable to work, we cannot expect them to afford rent.  

As this pandemic persists, I will continue calling for a rent freeze so working families, seniors, small businesses and others do not risk falling behind. 

#CancelRent

https://t.co/6G8lWyufPQ

#coronavirus reminds us of the importance of affordable healthcare. Whether it's preexisting conditions or lower drug prices, the #ACA continues delivering for our communities 10 years later. That's why I joined my colleagues today demanding @realDonaldTrump #DropTheLawsuit https://t.co/9JgcYEcpcu

No one should have to be put in the position of being unable to afford medication for themselves or a loved one. @HouseDemocrats‚Äô plan to #LowerDrugCosts saves Medicare money AND helps reduce the burden of costly prescription drug prices for American families. https://t.co/3DadwQiPae
